lead_paragraph: Russia in 1812 One of the things about Napoleon in Russia that Leo Tolstoy could not rationally explain was why the famous and disastrous retreat from Russia ever took place. It is Tolstoy's opinion, set down in "War and Peace," that after the burning of Moscow the French Emperor should have headed not for home but southwestward into the rich and warm Ukraine.

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS
